description.value: Adult outpatient (excluding unstable/emergent patients) needing Cardiology consult for arrhythmia evaluation
Clinical Providers in Primary Care Clinic
Ensure a minimum workup is initiated prior to a Cardiology Consultation for adult patients who present to a Primary Care Clinic for evaluation of bradycardia, syncope, or near syncope

name.value: Professor, Cardiovascular Medicine, University of Utah School of Medicine; Staff Cardiologist, Salt Lake City VA Medical Center

Professor of Medicine, Wayne State University; Section Chief, Cardiology, John Dingell VAMC

elm:annotation.a:s: Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram to evaluate for arrhythmia

title.value: Consults and Referrals

description.value: Consider other consult modalities which may be available (e.g., e-consult or other rapidly iterative consult method. A simple consult is included here as the overarching clinical intent.

textEquivalent.value: Referral to cardiology to evaluate bradycardia

title.value: Specific goal of the cardiology consultation (e.g., cardiology to manage patient, cardiology to risk stratify and recommend management, etc.)
Imaging and ECG
Consider ordering prior to the cardiology consultation. Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram is required if it has not been obtained within the past two months.

textEquivalent.value: Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram to evaluate for arrhythmia now
Holter monitor to evaluate for bradycardia now
Cardiac event monitor to evaluate for bradycardia now
X-ray chest to evaluate for heart failure now

title.value: Laboratory Tests

description.value: Consider the following tests to be completed prior to the cardiology consultation.

textEquivalent.value: Basic metabolic panel now
Complete blood count now
Lipid panel now
Thyroid function testing now
Troponin now
Brain natriuretic peptide now
D-dimer now

description.value: Consider discontinuation of nonessential negative chronotropic drugs (e.g., beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, etc.).

textEquivalent.value: Discontinue nonessential negative chronotropic drugs (e.g., beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, etc.)

elm:value.value: Nonessential negative chronotropic drugs (e.g., beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, etc.)

title.value: Consults and Referrals

textEquivalent.value: Referral to cardiology to evaluate syncope
Referral to cardiology to evaluate presyncope

title.value: Imaging and ECG

textEquivalent.value: Resting 12-lead electrocardiogram to evaluate for syncope/presyncope now
Echocardiogram to evaluate for left ventricular function now

title.value: Holter monitor to evaluate for syncope/presyncope now

prompt.value: Obtain Holter Monitor Evaluation Duration in Hours

textEquivalent.value: Holter monitor to evaluate for syncope/presyncope now

title.value: Cardiac event monitor to evaluate for syncope/presyncope now

prompt.value: Obtain Cardiac Event Monitor Evaluation Duration in Hours

textEquivalent.value: Cardiac event monitor to evaluate for syncope/presyncope now

title.value: X-ray chest to evaluate for heart failure now

textEquivalent.value: X-ray chest to evaluate for heart failure now

title.value: Laboratory Tests

description.value: Consider the following tests to be completed prior to the cardiology consultation.

textEquivalent.value: Basic metabolic panel now
Complete blood count now

Thyroid function testing now
Troponin now
Brain natriuretic peptide now
D-dimer now

description.value: Consider discontinuation of nonessential negative chronotropic drugs (e.g., beta-blockers, calcium channel blockers, etc.).
